item.tib: shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag brgya pa
item.note: At the end of a folio with vol. sig. and page no. torn away, which from script type and content must be Ka-Nga 51 (i.e. Ka 351, the final folio of this volume), a scribal note (on recto, verso blank): snyel 'or bshes gnyen Klu mgon sgras bris // [folio damaged, some text missing, then, in much smaller, finer hand] 'wer btsun ba Man dzu ba tra dang / bshes nyen bSod nams snang gis nyis zhus // // [in larger hand] gsum zhus /..At end of Nga-Nga 25 (i.e. Nga 325) verso, in same hand, a scribal note: / .. / snyel 'or Dge' bsnyen Dad pa shes rab kyis b[ri]s // [erasure] / dang zhus / [next line] // snyas 'wer d[ge]' slong Man dzu ba tra dang / bshes nyen bSod nams snang gis nyis zhus bgyis te [?] dag // //. Variation in size could point to two different mss. In any case changes in handwriting show that two or more scribes have copied the text, which is confirmed by the two scribal notes found.

item.tib: shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag brgya pa
item.coloph: No colophon, but a scribal note appears at end of text (folio Nya-nga 43b1, after shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag brgya' pa las / yongs su gtad pa'i le'u ste / bdun bcu drug pa'o // // rdzogs sho // // [in a smaller hand:] sna nam zhang btsun 'khyam mes bla zhus dag par bgyis // // [followed by Sanskrit formulae, including ye dharma]. Note also at Nya-nga 26a8-9: shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag brgya' pa'i mjug ma tshang ba rgya las bsgyur te bsnan pa / bam po sum bcu' bdun pa'o //.
item.note: Details recorded for this unit are incomplete and could not be supplemented or verified since no photographic record has yet been made. The title for le'u 76 may indicate that the text of the Nyi khri was used to complete the copy.

item.tib: 'Phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag brgya' pa
item.coloph: On xx3a6 the words snyel 'or klu mgon sgras bris // / // dang, followed by about 35 letters which have been almost completely erased, almost certainly deliberately. On the next line (a7) begins a long dedicatory inscription, the full text of which can be found in Scherrer-Schaub 1999b.
item.note: See Scherrer-Schaub 1999b. On Ga 1a1: shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag brgya pa dum bu gsum pa // bam po dang po'o //. It is possible that some of the folios included here may belong with R. No. 182, a nyi khri copy in an identical hand dating from the same period.

item.tib: shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa
item.coloph: Text ends sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa rdzogsho // // shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las rjes su gtad pa'i le'u ste bdun bcu rtsa bdun pa'o // // bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo // ox1e43; mu ne dharma / sang gha dharma / bhi mu ni dharma / sa sa anu gha te dharma / bhe sha ra ni ba ra dharma / sarba ka ri ni pri tsa dharma / sa man ta a nu pa ri bar dha ni svaha / 'bum gyi snying po'o // ox1e43; ma ha prad dznya shu ti mri ti bi dza ye svaha / nyi khri ba'i snying po'o // ox1e43; dhi dha ra ni pradznya pa le svaha / shes rab khri brgyad pa'i snying po'o // na max1e25; sa man ta bud dha ya / ox1e43; na ma bha ra dha dharma mu la bhi ni svaha / shes rab mdo brgyad pa'i snying po'o // ox1e43; mu ne mu ne ma ha mu ne ye pra dznya pa ra mi ta ye svaha // shes rab khri pa'i snying po'o // na mo bhudha ya [na mo dharma ya written beneath line] / na mo sang gha ya / a dan ti dha ra ni / … [text continues]
item.note: No translator colophon as such, but the remaining lines of the recto of this final folio are taken up with a text which gives dharax1e47;x12b;s epitomizing the various larger Prajnyaparamita texts (described as hx1e5b;daya, snying po), lists the twelve classes of scripture, and describes the merits deriving from the recitation of these dharax1e47;x12b;s. The style of the script and the absence of archaic orthography indicate a later ms.

item.coloph: Le'u division followed on lines 9-10 by: 'di 'bris dge bas bdag cag dpon slob yon chod rtso byas ma rgan 'grug sems can rnams yum chen sher phyin don rtogs nas dag pa'i zhing du skye bar shog / plus ox1e43; ye dharma, etc., followed by svaha // dge'o // dag go // he he he he //
item.note: Le'u 56 here corresponds to le'u 55 in the Derge version. The verso is blank, indicating that this was the final folio of Vol. 7 of the text, presumably complete in 8 vols.

item.coloph: None, but after four lines of text on the recto a prayer follows, written below in three lines in a smaller hand: // myi 'ched lho'i 'jig rten 'dzam gling 'dir // shag kya thub pa'i bstand pa rab rgyas kyang // 'dus pa dang po'i 'khor du ma gtogs na yang // gsung gyis 'dul ba'i [not entirely legible due to bird droppings] dus su bzhabs tsam bslebs / dka' dang mthun bar bsgrub pa ma nus kyang // snyigs ma lnga'i dus su dka' ba sna tshogs kyis // yum 'gyurd shes rab pha rold phyind ma 'di bzhengs pas // bdag dang dus gsum pha ma mtha' yas sems can rnams // nyon mongs dus gsum rtsa nas bslong bgyid cing // 'gro ba'i ris drug lam ni rgyud lnga nas // khams gsum sems can ma lus yongs bsgral nas // theg pa gsum po rims kyis bgrong nas kyang // dmyigs myed chos kyi sku ru bdag 'gyurd te // brts[o]m ba myed pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams nas kyang // pha rol phyin pa drug dang ma bral bar // sngo ba myed pa‘i smon lam 'debs par shog //
item.note: Last folio of the volume. Verso is blank except for the words sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //.

item.loc: Not recorded. Last extant folio is Pha-Nga 21

For a detail of one folio see Scherrer-Schaub + Bonani 2002: 206, Fig. 28b.

(number partially erased: 44?), 47, 53-58, 64-66, 70, 72 (vol. sig. given as both Kha and Ga), 76, 85-86, 89, 92-94, 96(?); Ga 3-7, 9, 12-19, 21-25, 30-33, 36-42, 44-45, 64, 69; Kha 5, 7-8, 17, 19-21, 23, 30-52, 54-55, 57-58, 58/61 (?), 66; Kha 8 (sequence?); Kha 69-73, 78-79, 80(?), 81, 83-85, 88, 102-108, 116, 118-120, 21(read 121), 122-126, 130-135, 144-155, 159, 161-162, 166-170, 173(?), 174-176, 178-185, 187, 189-190, 192, 194-197, 205-207, 217, 222-223, 225-226, 260; plus I-XXV: 25 folios with vol. sig. and folio nos. lost through burn and tear damage, numbered in the order of appearance in the photographic record; I with le'u 12 on verso, therefore must be Kha series; II with le'u 19 on verso (must be Ga series); III with le'u 20 on verso (ditto); IV with le'u 42 on verso (second Kha series), V with le'u 39 on recto (ditto), VI with le'u 37 on verso (ditto), XVI (-84), XVII (-2), XVIII (-7)
item.tib: shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa
item.coloph: Not extant. On Ga 45b13 a scribal note in dbu can appears beneath the le'u 25 mark: // // 'di yan cad kho blas dge' slong gzhon nu (?) byang chub kyis bris //, followed by pictures of a stx16b;pa and a vase.
item.note: See De Rossi Filibeck 1994. The folios appear to have been numbered Ka, Kha, Ga (100 fols. each), then beginning again with Ka (1-100?; this series apparently lost), Kha 1-260+. There may also have been a second Ga series. Since the same vol. sig. is used more than once, detailed work on the text is required to confirm the sequence of folios.

item.note: The translation differs markedly from that in the Derge Kanjur. It appears that le'u are not numbered consecutively throughout the work but according to volume, whereas bam po may have originally been numbered consecutively. This is suggested by the erasure and correction of bam po numbers after the Ka-Ma series. See also the note on illustrations.

item.coloph: Text ends (folio Nga 6a8-9): bzhi pa'i bzhi cha rdzogs te khri pa rdzogs sho // // // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / prad nya bar ma dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan pa phab pa' // // dang zhus / (in different hand). Below the last line the words shog byang gi grangs sum brgya' drug appear in faded and barely visible dbu med. The originally blank verso bears a couple of lines of crudely formed letters, perhaps as writing practice.

item.loc: 3, 104(?), 107-110 (from 104 onwards the numbers are preceded by a cross)
item.tib: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa rdo rje gcod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: No colophon, but conclusion of the text is followed by a note in a smaller dbu med hand: // dge' bslong yon rin gyi bsbyin par bya ba'i chos ta bo'i reg zeg //, with a round red spot to the right of it (left by a seal?)
item.note: Since 3 is continuous with 104, the crosses (= 100) preceding the numbers on all the other folios may have been added later.
Since this unit has not yet been photographed, full details cannot be given.

item.loc: Ka 19, 24, 42-44, 46, 48-50, 52, 61, 66, 69, 71-73, plus one folio with number lost

item.tib: unidentified
item.note: This incipit page carries two illustrations. The image on the left is a Buddha in bhx16b;misparshamudra, that on the right is less distinct, but may depict a female figure, possibly Prajnyaparamita. The text in the centre is (in large letters) rgya gar skad du /. Assignment to a known manuscript unit on the basis of size is not possible, but certain formal characteristics like the siddhax1e43; suggest a ca. 15th century date (cf. the image in Scherrer-Schaub + Bonani 2002, Fig. 20.6). Carbon-14 dating gives an age-range of 1447-1640 (ibid. p. 211). Detailed arthistorical comparison of the images would be required to confirm this.

item.tib: 'phags pa pha rold tu phyind pa lnga bstand pa theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: Ga-Ma 67a1: bsam gtan gyi pha rold tu phyind pa las le'u 4 //rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
item.note: Only the conclusion and colophon are extant on Ga-Ma 67a1-2

item.tib: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa bdun brgya ba zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa lnga brgya pa'o
'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa rdo rje gcod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po shi lend dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes ti ka dang sbyar te zhus nas / slad kyis gtan la phab pa' // (on Ga-Nga 29a1)
item.note: Text probably began on Ga-Nga 18.

item.tib: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa'i tshul brgya lnga bcu pa
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / shi len dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
item.note: Text differs in certain respects from that translated by Conze (1973: 184-195).

item.tib: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa' lnga bcu pa'o
item.note: With the exception of the first few paragraphs, most of the text is lost.

item.tib: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa yi ge nyu ngu zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa / ko'u shi ka zhes bya ba'o

item.note: Because no volume signature can be made out on this folio, its placement in this unit is uncertain. It could have formed part of the Nga series.

item.tib: shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo' / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: After Kha 56, the folio numbering changes to cursive. In this ms the title is given only with le'u divisions, not with bam po divisions.

item.loc: 4, 6, 17, 19, 26, 28-30, 33(? margin burnt), 35, 37, 39, 44, 48-53, 56-58, 60, 63-64, 70-76, 79, 82, 84, 86, 88-91, 94, 98; plus extra series: 57, 82, 90; plus fols. I-VI (6 folios with burn damage at left end and consequent loss of folio nos.)
item.note: Close study of the entire manuscript is required to determine whether the six folios lacking their numbers belong to this unit or to Cat. Nos. 1.2.3 or 1.2.4. The folios designated ”Extra series” may also belong to another ms. Note that in this ms bam po details are not accompanied by the text's title. Many of the folios in this unit belong to the Gax1e47;x1e0d;avyx16b;ha, and can thus be compared with the text as published in Steinkellner 1995.

item.tib: shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: From Kha 64 on, 11 lines per page (different copy). For the internal title, found at Kha 25b4 + Kha 64a10, cf. Derge Sangs rgyas rmad ga cad ces bya ba shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo. Title not given at bam po divisions.

item.tib: 'phags pa shind tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: Fol. 24 has crude scribble in the margins. Many folios damaged by burning. Internal title given at bam po divisions. Close study of the entire manuscript is required to determine whether the five folios lacking their numbers belong to this unit or to R. Nos. 143 or 259.

item.loc: I, II, III (3 fols. with numbers lost due to tearing or burn damage), 2, 9, 13-14, 18, 19, 26, 37, 43, 50-51, 53, 59, 61, 63-64, 66-70, 72-73, 75-76, 78, 81, 82, 83, 84, 94, 97 (not continuous with following), 98-100; plus extra folios: 26, 29 (2 fols. with this number), 31, 57, 63 (2 fols. with this number), 66, 69, 70 (2 fols. with this number)
item.tib: 'phags pa shind tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: The presence of three folios numbered 63 indicates that this unit may have numbered up to 300 folios, without the hundreds being marked except by position in the bundle (if indeed all the folios here came from the same bundle). Without close study of the text, therefore, the folios cannot be arranged in their proper order. Folios are not marked as consecutive (e.g. 13-14 rather than 13, 14) unless they clearly form a series. That bam po 2 appears on fol. 100 also suggests that in this unit the bam po numbering is not consecutive through the whole work.

item.tib: 'phags pa shind tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: These folios contain text from the Gax1e47;x1e0d;avyx16b;ha section of the Avatax1e43;saka. Bam po 102 here = Derge Vol. A, bam po 9.

item.tib: 'phags pa shind tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: Internal title given at the bam po division

item.tib: 'phags pa shind tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: In this ms the internal title is given at the bam po divisions. Folio numbers seem to have been added after the ms was written (cf. Cat. No. 1.2.9). Mention of Nor bzangs, e.g. on fol. Ka 12a, Ka 99b, indicate that this is the volume containing the Gax1e47;x1e0d;avyx16b;ha.

item.loc: I-XVII (Folios never numbered. Here designated by roman numerals in the order in which they appear in the photographic record.)
item.tib: 'phags pa shind tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo / sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba
item.note: Internal title given at the bam po divisions. Only close study of the content of the folios will determine their correct order. Many of the folios seem to carry text from le'u 30, which is consistent with the bam po numbering.

item.tib: 'phags pa bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u
item.note: 9a1: 'char byed kyis zhus pa // bam po gcig go //. The text must therefore begin on the missing folio 8b. Although this folio resembles 1.3.1.4 in many respects, the dimensions are slightly different, the siddhax1e43; is not followed by two dots, and the ends of verses are not marked by triple shads, as is normal in that unit. We therefore assign it to a different ms (of which it appears to be the sole surviving folio).
This may well have been part of the unit 1.3.2.

item.tib: kun nas sgo'i le'u
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / kun nas sgo'i le'u zhes bya ba ste // le'u bcu pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang /zhu chen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa // 'gnyis bzhus //
item.note: Only three lines used on the verso suggest that this may be the last folio of a volume.
Cf. the next entry, for a fragment of a different ms of the same text.
Cf. the previous entry, for a fragment of a different ms of the same text.

item.loc: 184, 1 lacking number (due to left end being torn off)

item.tib: 'phags pa lag bzangs kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po da na shi la dang / 'dzi na myi tra dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te / skad gsar chad kyis kyang bcos na gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa des pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa dpas byin gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog stsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las le'u nyi shu brgyad pa ste / dpas byin gyis zhus pa / bam po gcig go //

item.tib: bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed kyis zhus pa zhes pa'i le'u
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed kyis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs sho //.

item.tib: bu mo blo gros bzang mos zhus pa'i le'u
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / bu mo blo gros bzang mos zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste / sum bcu pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa mya ngan myed kyis byin pa lung bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las le'u sum bcu rtsa gnyis pa ste / mya ngan myed kyis byin pas zhus pa bam po gcig pa'/ rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa /

item.tib: 'phags pa dri ma myed kyis byin pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las le'u sum cu gsum pa ste / dri ma myed kyis byin pas zhus pa / bam po dang po'o //

item.tib: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis myi khyab pa bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las le'u sum cu lnga pa ste sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis myi khyab pa bstand pa / bam po dang po'o //

item.tib: lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa drug pa rdzogs sho // ban de klu'i rgyal mtshand kyis bsgyurd cing zhus //

item.tib: 'phags pa seng ge zhus pa zhes bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las le'u sum cu bdun pa ste / seng ges zhus pa / bam po phyed (do?) rgya gar gyi mkhan po da na shi la dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te / skad gsar chad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa

item.tib: 'phags pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsang cen thabs la mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dam pas zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsang chen thabs la mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' ye shes dam pas zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa brgyad pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / sum cu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra ba de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsha pa ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: bu mo rnam dag dang bas zhus pa
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo stong phrag brgya pa las bu mo rnam dag dang bas zhus pa'i 'dus pa ste / 'dus pa bzhi bcu pa rdzogs sho //
item.note: skabs 'dir le'u bzhi bcu pa ste / bu mo dang ldan gyis zhus pa bam po phyed / go rims kyis 'byung ba las ma 'gyur te / nam 'gyur nas bri //. This is followed on line 2 by the invocation to the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, then by the start of the text ('di skad bdag gis thos pa ...). No titles are given.

item.tib: 'phags pa byams pas zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste / theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las byams pas zhus pa zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu gcig pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa byams pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las byams pas zhus pa zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu gcig pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
item.note: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa ste / byams pas zhus pa 'og ma / bam po phyed do //

item.tib: rin po che'i phung po
item.coloph: No colophon. Text ends Ka-Na 90b8 with the words: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / rin po che'i phung po'i le'u zhes bya ba ste / bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa rdzogs sho //.
item.note: In the lower margin of fol. 84b, under the word dgon written in dbu can, there are two lines of annotation in dbu med.

item.loc: Ka-Na 90, 93-95, (9)8 (folio torn, with partial loss of number), 99, Ka-Ma 1-2, 5, 8-11
item.tib: 'phags pa 'od srung gi le'u zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / 'od srung gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa rdzogs sho // // rgya'i le'u sbyor las kun snang gi le'u zhes 'byung // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd te / skad gsar chad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa blo gros myi zad pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / blo gros myi zad pas zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa bdun brgya pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / 'jam dpal gyis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa drug pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po ches zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa ste gtsug narin po ches zhus pa / bam po dang po'o //

item.tib: 'phags pa lha mo dpal 'phreng seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las dpal 'phreng gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste / bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa' //

item.tib: 'phags pa drang srong rgyas pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / drang srong rgyas pas zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs sho //, followed by the words (in red ink): shag kya'i dge slong bzod mdzes shes rab kyi sbyin bar bya ba'i chos so //. rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / da na shi la dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te / skad gsar cad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: go cha'i bkod pa bstand pa'i 'dus pa
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo' stong phrag brgya' pa las // go cha'i bkod pa bstand pa'i 'dus pa ste / 'dus pa bdun pa rdzogs sho //.
item.note: The missing folio with the beginning of the text (Kha 66?) may have been replaced by the matching folio in R. No. 252. Cat. No. 1.3.0.2 may well preserve remains of the first volume of this set.

item.tib: 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dbyer myed par bstand pa πes bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs stong phrag brgya' pa las / 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dbyer myed par bstand pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste // brgyad pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su lend dra bo de dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te / gtan la phab pa' //

item.tib: 'phags pa kun nas sgo zhes bya ba'i le'u
item.coloph: 'Phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs stong phrag brgya pa las // 'phags pa kun nas sgo zhes bya ba'i le'u ste // bcu pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te / gtan la phab pa' //

item.loc: Kha-Na 89, 99; Kha-Ma 26, 32 (these two fol. preceeded by three small strokes indicating the hundreds), 34-38, 41
item.tib: 'phags pa 'od gzer bsgrub pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'Phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs stong phrag brgya pa las // le'u bcu gcig pa // 'od gzer kun nas bkye ba bstand pa // bam po dang po pa //

item.note: This text appears to follow Rashmisamantamuktanirdesha directly in this unit. Missing folios in this text have been made up in the restoration ms R. No. 252.

item.loc: Ka 72-75, 77-78, 80, 82-89, 91-93, 95, plus one folio with number lost due to tearing; Ka-Na 1, 4-5, 8

item.tib: rmyi lam bstand pa
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / rmyi lam bstand pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po prad nya bar ma dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sdes las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa 'od dpag myed kyi bkod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
'Phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa myi 'khrugs pa'i bkod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.note: In this text chapter titles are followed by the words rdzogs sho. However, in numbering the chapters the scribe has apparently skipped 4, thus his le'u 5 should be le'u 4 and his le'u 6 should be le'u 5. It is also possible that the missing fols. Ka-Ma 16-18 contained an additional chapter division - in other versions, giving this version of the text seven chapters rather than the usual six.

item.tib: 'phags pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dbyer myed pa bstand pa bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo

item.loc: Ga 20-25, 27-28, 32-34, 38-40, 44, 50-51, 53-56, 58-59, 62-63, 67-69, 72-73, 74 {84}, 78 {88}, 85 {75}, 86 {76}, 96, 99; Ga-Na 1, 3-5, 7, 10, 12, 16-20, 22-25, 27, 31, 52, 54-55, 59, 62, 64-67, 78, 81-82, 85, 87-95, 97-98, 200; Ga-Ma 1-2, 4-5, 8, 10 [In those cases where a folio carries two numbers, the number which is incorrect is given in curly brackets. One assumes that these numbers were added later (see Pagel 1999).]
item.tib: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod
item.note: See Pagel 1999 for detailed study. This is his Bdp I, dated to the 11th century (p. 184). Crudely drawn crosses to mark hundreds have been added by a later hand, and there is occasionally clumsy scrawl in the margins. Bam po divisions are preceded by the words dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i mdo'. See Cat. No. 1.3.6 (R. No. 252b) for evidence of later restoration.
Crudely drawn crosses to mark hundreds have been added by a later hand.

item.tib: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'khrugs pa'i bkod pa zhes bya ba ste / le'u drug pa
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na mi tra dang // su ren dra bo de dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sdes sgyur cing / zhus he [error for te] gtan la phab pa' // bam po lnga pa / shu lo ga bzhi bcu'o //
item.note: Note that most or all of this unit appears to have been prepared as a restoration manuscript, to fill gaps in other mss. This is proven beyond doubt for several of the texts it contains

item.tib: go cha'i bkod pa bstan pas zhus pa zhes bya ba / theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'Phags pa dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las // le'u bdun pa ste / go cha bkod pa stan pa //

item.tib: 'od zer kun tu bkye ba
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po'i mdo // stong phrag rgya pa las // 'od zer kun tu bkye ba'i 'dus pa ste / 'dus pa gcig pa // rdzogs sho //.

item.tib: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'phags pa / dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs // le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan bkod pa / bstan pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste / bco lnga pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po / shi len dra bo de dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye she bsdes bsgyur to // skad gsar kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa'o // bam po gsum dang / shu lo ka brgya bzhi bcu / dge'o //

item.loc: 11, 24, 25, 28 (no vol. sig., or destroyed by burning)
item.coloph: This text presumably stood first in this volume, which may have belonged to the same unit as the previous items.

item.loc: 255 (hundreds marked by crosses; vol. sig. unknown, destroyed by burning)
item.coloph: Folio number relative to Derge version suggests that this leaf belonged to the same volume as the preceding text. Irregular spacing in the last lines of the verso point to a restoration manuscript, most probably for Cat. No. 1.3.6 (R. No. 251).

item.loc: Ka Ka 90 (black, horizontal, 2 Kas side by side)
item.note: Unidentified

According to Pagel (1999) these folios (his Bdp II) were prepared to fill gaps in Cat. No. 1.3.4 (R. No. 9), to the missing folios of which its page numbers and text correspond exactly. The formal characteristics of the ms and the scribal hand differ in minor respects from Cat. No. 1.3.5 (R. No. 252a + 252c), but it may well have been prepared by the same copyist. It is assumed that this was originally part of a larger dKon brtsegs restoration manuscript, like the preceding item.

item.tib: 'phags pa lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis zhus pa
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs // le'u stong phrag brgya pa las // 'phags pa lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste // sum bcu rtsa drug pa rdzogs sho // // ban de klu'i rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur cing zhus // // shu log gxf1;i / shu log stong gxf1;is brgya // bax1e43; po bzhi pa //
item.note: This text presumably began on folio 1 of what must have been the last volume of a dKon brtsegs ms. See the following entries for the remains of five texts from this volume.
Folios in parentheses have lost their numbers due to fire damage. Their position in the ms has been determined by comparison with the Derge text.

item.tib: 'phags pa lha mo dpal 'phreng gi seng ge'i sgra zhus pa
item.coloph: skad gsar chad kyis kyang bcos nas / gtan la phab pa // // // 'phags pa dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u bzhi bcu brgyad pa ste / lha mo dpal 'phreng gi seng ge'i sgra zhus pa / bam po dang po //

item.note: The sequence of folio numbers indicates that the Px16b;rx1e47;aparipx1e5b;ccha-sx16b;tra was not included in this unit. There is, however, room for the Rax1e63;x1e6d;rapala-paripx1e5b;ccha between the preceding text and this one.
This text must have followed directly after the Ugradattaparipx1e5b;ccha.

item.tib: cho 'phrul chen po bstand pa / lha'i bu ded dpon gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u
item.coloph: cho 'phrul chen po bstand pa / lha'i bu ded dpon gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste / xf1;i shu gxf1;is pa rdzogs sho // // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'Dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / prad xf1;a bar ma dang / zhu cen gyi lo pa ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa byams pa'i seng ge'i sgra chen po zhes bya ba / theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u xf1;i shu gsum pa ste / byams pa'i seng ge sgra chen po bstand pa

item.tib: lag bzangs kyis zhus pa
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las lag bzangs kyis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste xf1;i shu drug pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po da na shi la dang / 'dzi na myi tra dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te / skad gsar chad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa des pas zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / des pas zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste / xf1;i shu bdun pa / rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba bad de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa dpas byin gyis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u xf1;i shu brgyad pa ste / dpas byin gyis zhus pa //

item.tib: lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis ba
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las // lha'i bu blo gros rab gnas kyis ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste / gsum bcu rtsa drug pa rdzogs sho // // cog kru klu'i rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur cing zhus // //

item.tib: 'phags pa tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las // le'u sum bcu rtsa dgu ste bzang skyong gis zhus pa //

'phags pa dkon mchog rtsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / byams pas zhus pa zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa gxf1;is pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su len dra bo de dang / zhu chen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sde sbygurd cing zhus te / gtan la bab pa //

item.loc: Kha 12, 21-25, 42 (=27), 28, 30-31, plus 2 folios with burnt and broken margins (= Kha 26, 32)
item.tib: 'phags pa 'od srung gi le'u zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa ste / byang chub sems dpa' kun nas snang gis zhus pa / bam po dang po'o /
item.note: One folio has been misnumbered as Kha 42 and included as part of the Ratnarashi-sx16b;tra. It has also undergone an attempt at repair, with replacement text written in a greatly inferior hand.

item.tib: 'phags pa rin po che'i phung po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: 'Phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las // le'u bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi pa ste // rin po che'i phung po'i mdo' // // bam po dang po'o //
item.note: Note that this text appears to have had its folios numbered incorrectly, incorporating in the process one folio of the Kashyapa-parivarta (Kha 42) in error. This may have been done after some folios were lost, with those remaining being renumbered consecutively. Taking the incipit folio no. Kha 38 as a point of departure (although it too may not be original), we present the putatively correct numbers in parentheses.
Note that the folio numbers here may not be the original ones. See preceding entry.

item.tib: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rold tu phyind pa / bdun brgya pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.note: Note that the folio numbers here may not be the original ones. See preceding entry.

item.tib: sdom pa gsum bstand pa'i le'u zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'

item.tib: 'od dpag myed kyi bkod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba

item.tib: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa myi 'khrugs pa'i bkod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.note: This text is not followed by the Varmavyx16b;ha-nirdesha in this ms.

item.tib: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dbyer myed par bstand pa

item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / / bu mo blo gros bzang mos zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / sum bcu pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa // dang zhus //

item.tib: 'phags pa gang 'ga'i mchog ces bya ba'i mdo
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / / gang ga'i mchog gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / sum bcu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs sho // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / da na shi la dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te / skad gsar cad kyis kyang bcos nas / gtan la phab pa //

item.tib: 'phags pa mya ngan myed kyis byin pa lung bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo

This folio and the next (Ga 22) may have come from a different unit than the rest of Running No. 263, although another volume may have intervened.

item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa

item.note: The binding circles on folio 148a have been further decorated with an 8-petalled flower design around the string holes.

item.note: Note that Ratnarashi is given as 43rd section of Ratnakx16b;x1e6d;a.

item.loc: 317, 320, I ( folio with number lost through burn damage), 327, II (folio with number missing), 333-339, 341-342, 345, III (folio without number, unplaced)
item.tib: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che ches zhus pa
item.coloph: zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de dar ma ta shx12b; las zhus te / skad gsar cad kyis kyang bcos nas gtan la phab pa

item.loc: 345-346, 348-354, 357, 358 (numbered as 258), plus 3 folios without numbers (VI, IV, III = 361-363)
item.tib: 'Phags pa lha mo dpal 'phreng gi seng ge'i sgra zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.note: Folio number of 353 is partly erased, with only 3 visible. Text appears to have been copied out of place on fol. 357. Folios with numbers missing, appearing in this and the following entries, are numbered I, II, etc. in accordance with their position in the photographic record. Folio III is the penultimate folio (363?), immediately preceded by fol. IV (362?), which is preceded by fol. VI (almost certainly 361, since traces of a g can be seen).

item.loc: 365, 381, and 3 folios with numbers mssing, i.e., I (=367?), II, V
item.note: Folio 365 must be the second folio in the text, which would have begun on 364.

This manuscript appears to have had additional volume signatures inscribed on some of its folios, possibly to mark separate bundles. If we assume that the red volume signatures are original, then only folios from the Ka and Nga volumes have survived. That the latter are sometimes marked with a black Kha may indicate that they at that time constituted the second volume. Closer study of the ms is needed to confirm this.

item.tib: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba bsam gyis myi khyab pa bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / da na shi la dang / mu ne bar ma dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa ban de ye shes sde las / stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa' / dang zhus /
item.note: The addition by a later hand of two crosses to designate the 200 series is a mistake, since we estimate that the text would have occupied folios Ka 99-195 of this manuscript. Indeed, several of the folios have not been renumbered in this way, indicating that when the ms was first produced hundreds were not marked except by position in the bundle. We use square brackets to indicate that this later renumbering should be ignored. Two diamond-shaped arrangements of four circles decorate le'u divisions (one before and one after), while a single such device marks the point where the bam po divisions (not otherwise specified) would fall.

item.tib: 'phags pa rmyi lam bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.note: The addition by a later hand of two crosses to designate the 200 series is a mistake, since we estimate that the text would have occupied folios Ka 99-195 of this manuscript. Indeed, several of the folios have not been renumbered in this way, indicating that when the ms was first produced hundreds were not marked except by position in the bundle. We use square brackets to indicate that this later renumbering should be ignored. Two diamond-shaped arrangements of four circles decorate le'u divisions (one before and one after), while a single such device marks the point where the bam po divisions (not otherwise specified) would fall.

item.tib: lha'i blo gros rab gnas kyis zhus
item.note: The addition of the black Kha may indicate that this is now the second extant volume in the unit, or that these folios fall in the one hundred series.

item.tib: 'phags pa seng ges zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste sum cu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs sho // // rgya gar gyi mkhan po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren 'dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sdes zhus te gtan la phab pa // gxf1;is zhus // [followed by important note:] skabs 'dir le'u bzhi bcu pa ste / bu mo dad ldan gyis zhus pa bam po phyed / gro rims kyis 'byung ba las ma 'gyur te / nam 'gyur nas bri // //

item.tib: 'phags pa byams pas zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste / theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.coloph: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las / byams pas zhus pa zhes bya ste / le'u bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa rdzogs so // // rgya gar skad du khan (corrected to mkhan) po 'dzi na myi tra dang / su ren 'dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsha ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la [end of folio].
item.note: The numbers on both folios show evidence of overwriting.

item.tib: 'phags pa byams pas zhus pa

These folios cannot belong to the same unit as that comprised of R. Nos. 315 + 309 (Cat. No. 1.4.25.2), even though they have some features in common and the marginal title (added at a later date?) is in the same hand. They may form part of a similar ms unit produced around the same time.
Note that this ms is similar in many respects to R. No. 265, which carries the same text, but they are not the same ms.

This may indicate that the smaller mDo chen po stong pa xf1;id preceded it in the unit. Since most of line 11 is left blank, it is unlikely that a translators' colophon appeared on the first line of the missing folio Kha 36. See Skilling 1994: xxxi-xxxiii; Skilling 1997: 195-197.

item.note: The Mahabherx12b;harakaparivarta would have begun on folio Ka 1.

item.tib: 'phags pa bde ldan ma lung bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: Despite the similarity in format, the text is not continuous with that of the same sx16b;tra on Ka 61 of Cat. No. 1.4.1. It is quite possible, however, that we have here remnants of two mDo mang mss copied from the same exemplar. If this is so, the Mahabherx12b;harakaparivarta would also have been the first text of Cat. No. 1.4.1. The other possibility is that this does belong to 1.4.1, but that one folio has been skipped by the scribe.

The same title is given at these points in Derge. No bam po divisions appear to be marked. Text would have ended on Cha 21a.

item.note: The folios listed above all appear to belong to this text, occupying approximately fols. (2)39-(3)60 in this ms. Further work is required to establish beyond doubt that the fragmentary folios also belong to this text. The wording of the text often differs slightly from the Derge version.

item.tib: 'phags pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden bstand pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'

item.tib: 'phags pa phyir myi ldog pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.note: Note that this text and the one which precedes it may be part of the same mDo mang collection as the previous unit (Cat. No. 1.4.14). Even if not, their formal similarities suggest that it was produced around the same time.

item.tib: 'phags pa khye'u bzhi'i ting nge 'dzind ces bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo
'phags pa bsod nams thams cad bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po prad nya bar ma dang / shi len dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa ba ban de ye shes sde las stsogs pas sgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
item.note: Folios Ga 93-94 have the vol. sig. “Gax1e43;.” Ṅa 12, the final folio of this text, from which the colophon details were taken, is not included in the photographic record. It appears to have become separated from this unit in Tabo.

item.loc: Nga [12], 14-15, 17-18, Ga (sic) 19-21, Nga 22, 26-28, 32-33, 35, 39, plus 1 folio with number lost due to tearing.

item.note: Nga 12, the incipit folio for this text, from which the title details were taken, is missiNg from the photographic record (see above). Three folios from this text (19-21) have been numbered with the vol. sig. Ga.

item.tib: chos thams cad kyi yon tan bkod pa'i rgyal po
item.note: The original sequence of texts in this unit is unclear, since the folios appear to have been numbered (secunda manu?) after the bundle was rearranged out of order. The wording of the translation of this text differs from that of Derge.

item.tib: 'phags pa nges pa dang / ma nges par 'gro ba'i phyag rgya la 'jug pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo'
item.coloph: rgya gar gyi mkhan po prad nya bar ma dang / su rin dra bo de dang / zhu cen gyi lo tsa pa pan de ye shes sde las stsogs pas bsgyurd cing zhus te gtan la phab pa' //
item.note: Kha 95 is continuous with Kha 71. To be renumbered as Kha 72? Kha 61 cannot originally have followed Kha 60, since the Sarvadharmagux1e47;avyx16b;haraja would have required one more folio to finish.

item.tib: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba / yi ge bam po gcig bshad pa'o //
item.note: See preceding entry for numbering of Kha 95. For the title, cf. Tōhoku 243, Za15b1. The wording of this version differs frequently from that of Derge.
The folios have been numbered out of sequence, and should be read in the following order: Kha 81(bar ma), 43, 44, 45, 46, 84, 85, 89, 82, 93.
This text would have begun on Ka 1 and possibly ended around Ka 56 in this manuscript unit.

item.loc: Kha (read Ka?) 59-64, 65/66 (on one folio), 68-70, 77-79, (9)1, 95, (9)6, 97, 100; Ka (read Kha?) 3; Kha 4/5 (on one folio); Kha 16-17, 19-21, 23, 30, 31-34; plus 1 folio fragment without vol. sig. or number
item.note: The volume signatures appear to have been misapplied to this ms, and the correct sequence of folios could only be established by comparison with the Derge version. The text may have begun on Kha (read Ka?) 56, following the end of the Suvikrantavikrami, and would probably have ended on Kha 35. It is, however, possible that this text and the Suvikrantavikrami were not originally part of the same ms unit. The siNgle fragmentary folio without vol. sig. or number may belong to a third text, but cannot be identified.
Text identified by Helmut Tauscher.

item.tib: 'phags pa dkon mchog 'byung gnas zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo

item.note: Given as unidentified in Harrison

Determining the order of folios in this unit is more than usually problematic since at some point after copying crosses have been added to mark the hundreds, but this has not always been done correctly. In this catalogue, therefore, [1]43 indicates a cross added in error, (1)43 a cross not added where it should have been. It appears that when the text was first copied, only position in the bundle would have enabled one to distinguish, say, fol. 50 from fol. 150. The Samadhiraja may have begun around fol. 80, finishing around fol. 210.
This text would have begun around folio 210 or 211.

It is possible that not all the following texts belong to this unit, but this can only be confirmed once all folios are identified. Changes in siddhax1e43;, script and volume signature complicate the picture. See also Cat. No. 1.4.24.

item.tib: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: This ms has the same formal characteristics and dimensions as Cat. No. 1.5.7, but preliminary work suggests that it is a separate unit. Text is that translated from Chinese by Wang pham zhum, dGe ba'i blo gros and rGya mtsho'i sde (Tōhoku 119).

item.tib: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: In this ms the numbers are written unusually close to the volume signature. Some of the Ka-Na series have a cross added before the number to clarify that it is 100 +, while some Ka-Ma series have two crosses added to show 200 +. Text is that translated from Chinese by Wang pham zhum, dGe ba'i blo gros + rGya mtsho'i sde (Tōhoku 119).

item.tib: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: On Ka 56a the last line of the folio is repeated in a clumsy hand (as writing practice?); see also Ka 98a for something similar. Over half the text on Ka 87b has been enclosed in a roughly drawn frame. Note that this is possibly the first volume of the ms which continues as Cat. No. 1.5.6. The script is very similar, as is the general format, but differences in the paper and the siddhax1e43; and the frequency of gi gu log in this ms suggest the work of different scribes. Detailed study is required to determine the relationship of the two mss. Text is that translated from Chinese by Wang pham zhum, dGe ba'i blo gros and rGya mtsho'i sde (Tōhoku 119).

item.tib: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: This ms possibly a continuation of the previous one (Cat. No. 1.5.5), i.e., its second volume (see above). Note that the bam po division at Cha 75a1 does not match that of Stog (which has bam po 42 beginning near this point in the text). Text is that translated from Chinese by Wang pham zhum, dGe ba'i blo gros and rGya mtsho'i sde (Tōhoku 119).

item.tib: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: This ms has the same formal characteristics and dimensions as Cat. No. 1.5.3, but preliminary work suggests that it is a separate unit. Text is that translated from Chinese by Wang pham zhum, dGe ba'i blo gros and rGya mtsho'i sde (Tōhoku 119).

item.loc: 2-5, 7, 9, 13, 16, 26, 34, 46, 51, 54, 56, 63-64, 71, 81-82, 86, 90, 92, 93 (2 fols. with this no., not identical), 95, 97, 99 (2 fols. with this no., not identical), 300, plus I-IV (4 fols. with numbers lost due to burn damage)
item.tib: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo
item.note: Apparently the remains of the second volume of a copy of the text. The absence of volume signatures, the presence of two pairs of folios bearing the same number and the existence of one folio numbered 300 mean that the folios could well follow a different order from that given above (but this order could only be determined through a close study of the text). E.g., 2-5 may not be sequential, 93 could be 93, 193, or even 293 (but note that neither of the two fols. 99 is continuous with fol. 300, so 299 is ruled out). Again, the translation is that made from Chinese by Wang pham zhum, dGe ba'i blo gros and rGya mtsho'i sde (Tōhoku 119).
